intro: Melandrium kawashimae, commonly known as the Kawashima catchfly, is a flowering plant native to Japan. It belongs to the family Caryophyllaceae and is characterized by its delicate, pinkish-white flowers that bloom in late summer. The plant typically grows in moist, shady environments such as forest floors and stream banks. Its leaves are oval-shaped with a hairy texture, and it produces small, capsule-like fruits that contain numerous seeds. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a rare and endangered species.
